metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15161 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: rpcapd/daemon.c in libpcap before 1.9.1 mishandles certain length values because of reuse of a variable. This may open up an attack vector involving extra data at the end of a request.

notes.Note: sbeattie> this is likely actually fixed by 449d95265252b291711899fd288836414791930d, and thus only affects windows platforms. even if accurate, it's against the libpcap daemon, introduced in 1.9.0 and is not included in debian/ubuntu packaging

criterions.comment: libpcap: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
